title: Urge Surfing
summary: Ride the wave of craving or anxiety without acting on it.
safety_notes: If you feel unsafe or the urge involves harm to self/others, stop and seek help (988 in the U.S.).
Mild discomfort is expected; reduce intensity if dizzy or panicky.

offCopy.intro: Notice the urge. We're going to surf it instead of fighting it.

steps.label: Name it
steps.body: What's the urge (0–10)? Where do you feel it in your body?

steps.label: Breathe lightly
steps.body: Nasal, quiet breaths. Let the sensations rise and fall like a wave.

steps.label: Stay curious
steps.body: Say: 'This is an urge. It will crest and pass.' Track it for 60–120s.

steps.label: Re-rate
steps.body: What is the urge now (0–10)? Note what helped.

offCopy.completion: You just rode a wave without reacting. Small wins build freedom.

verseKJV.text: There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful...

light.prompt: Invite God to steady you as the wave passes.

verseKJV.text: Walk in the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfil the lust of the flesh.

disciple.identity: In Christ, you are no longer a slave to urges.

verseKJV.text: For sin shall not have dominion over you...

kingdom.commission: Your restraint today equips you to strengthen others.
